caption: Amazing food and very friendly staff

A must-visit is the pizza pub in this town! Mouthwatering is the pizza that they serve. It was so tasty and fulfilling. This place's thin crust pizza is so delicious. The location has an outstanding atmosphere. It was so clean and cozy. The workers were also so welcoming and friendly. I am certainly going to visit this pizza bar again.

Stopped here for their “2 slices 1 free” for about $7-10 with tax I forget the exact price. The restaurant is very clean, the staff is friendly and fast, and the food is really good especially for the price. While it’s not the typical “deep dish” pizza you think of it’s a nice lighter alternative. I would recommend visiting this place for a quick bite if you’re in the area.
Best pizza and art
Buy 3 pieces get 1 free good deal.
Friendly staff. Good pizza. Buy 2 get 1 slice. It's a great deal.
Art of pizza deep dish is superior. I used to go to the location on Ashland not realizing a downtown location was available! Honestly the best of the best.

The Art of Pizza has always been my go to place for deep dish in Chicago. I was very glad that I was able to share this experience with my lady. She enjoyed it as well and agreed it was also her favorite deep dish from all the spots in Chicago.
Go here whenever I don't feel like cooking dinner. They have slices for sale either thin or stuff both around $5. Always quick and tasty. Carrot cake is amazing too!
Great

I address to a manager or an owner of Art of Pizza. I came the first time to order a big pizza for my family on 1/09/2021 in the evening. On the front was a "sweet lady" she didn't welcome me, and that is fine. I asked her where can I see a menu she pointed with her finger on the board without saying anything, I saw an obvious irritation. I asked her what is the popular one  and she turned her back to me and started to walk away, she said something that i couldn't hear, And I asked her can you repeat again please, she even didn't turn her head. So here is my point we live in 2020/2021 are they not easy years. And I'm pretty sure every guest for you is important. Your staff is lacking in culture of hospitality and welcoming. I get used to work in hospitality field and in 2020 I lost my job like many, many others. Your staff have to be more appreciative by still having they jobs. I walked away from your place, didn't have chance to try your cuisine, so I can't say anything about quality.

I don’t know how I don’t like Art of Pizza on State Street. Their ingredients were extremely fresh that made me think “vegetables are delicious.” However, I’d highly recommend you choose your favorite meat, either sausage or pepperoni. For the most flavorful pizza for you tonight, I’d share an old saying, “World’s nothing better without pepperoni pizza.”
Very good taste
eeeeeWe had a superb time in this place. We enjoyed the awesome environment and the meals. The staff members are super welcoming. I’m happy we ultimately managed to visit this place.

Bf really love this pizza. Good deep dish. Well seasoned and flavors. Mushroom pizza was good. The crust was slightly underbaked and doughy. But I think that’s normal about deep dish. So it’s pretty good if you’re not a big fan of deep dish pizza and if you are I think you’ll love it.
Great pizza that is very convenient.
Phenomenal
One of my favorite deep dish pizza places in Chicago.  Definitely better than those"Gio" or "Lou" places.
Pretty nice spot, definitely will be back
I hate the pizza of this house, especially the thin crust pepperoni
Maybe I just don’t like deep-dish like I used to when I was a kid, but it’s just crust and weird sauce to me.

This was some of the first deep dish that I was able to get my hands on in the city. I got a large deep dish of the Art Special, which was super good! Pizza was cooked well, but really I'd say their sauce was the best part. Super fresh!
I really enjoyed my deep dish pepperoni slice! It was my very first time in Chicago. Had a five hour layover and decided to ride the blue train by myself downtown! Got a slice and enjoyed every bite!
Great deep dish!
Amazing
This spot is fantastic! Affordable prices, big dishes and the staff are constantly very kind.
Nice people work here .
Very nice staff

Really good, mouth watering pizzas with just the right amount of cheese and meaty filling to satisfy even the hungriest carnivore(like me 😅). Only problem is finding parking which is hella annoying in the city.
I stumbled across this place while working up north.  I would drive from south lake shore drive to enjoy some of there delicious pizza.  Now there's one on state 🤗🤗
Went to this place on my lunch break. Restaurant was clean and the staff was super friendly.  I ordered the Italian sub, which was HUGE and tasty. I will be back to try other menu items.

This is a small shop right on the junction of State Street and Polk Street. I love their thick crust pizza which in my personal opinion is better than other big names in Chicago. Their mozzarella sticks are good too. Their pizza sauce (marinara sauce) needs special mention too.  Keep it up guys!
Pizza is great! Love the deep dish by the slice to go.
Awesome service
amazing!
Delicious pizza! Had the Deep Dish Art's Special slice and my husband had the Stuffed Crust Art's Special slice and we were both beyond pleased with the pizza.
You can try a wide range of Italian dishes at this place including their eggplant parmigiana and chicken parmigiana. They also have an impressive range of salads on offer that I often have for lunch.
Great
Amazing stuffed pizza!
This pizza is so expensive and didn’t even taste that good. 3 slices put me around $20. Everything was luke warm. Wouldn’t recommend this pizza place
Very nice pizza
Great service! The lady that was working today was fantastic and super kind :)
fresh pizza takes 45 min
The deep dish is excellent!!

This pizza was amazing. Stuffed crust. It was almost better the next day cold. Good sandwiches, good value. Pricier but quality food. Pizza sat on heater for 20 plus minutes while they made the sandwiches so kitchen coordination was a bit off. Told them we were in a hotel and needed flatware and napkins and condiments, they have us 1 mustard packet and 1 fork.
Cold pizza, poor quality.
The place offers an awesome variety of delicious food. I like dining here. The employees are always very kind, pricing is affordable and the spot is always kept clean.
First time trying this little place.  Big slices , cheap prices and friendly customer service!
I like this place because you can get a slice of all kind of pizza and they have a really good customer service and great prices
Very good pizza.
The names spot on cause the deep dish is a work of art. The hot slices of spinach mushroom and onion keep me going long days, usually after a small food coma.
Phenomenal by the slice place for deep dish and thin  The thin is some of the best in the city and the stuffed prolly is the best with it's tangy sauce and excellent ratios
Love it!!!
Deep dish is good. VERY heavy. Staff was friendly and pizza was ready on time.

I visit this unique place from time to time  as I like the special air that is unique to this place. The personel is extraordianrillyremarkably loving and professional. The service is deeply fast. Needless to say, the food they prepare is highly distinguished. I frequent more than once and I was always delighted. The payment is honest. I highly recommend this place to to everybody.
Great quality for by the slice. If you want a fulfilling deep dish slice without the wait, this gets it done. Not wowed by the taste, but you’ll still be satisfied.
Such good pizza!!
So good.
Deep dish pizza is Amazing🙊💕🦋
Good pizza thin crust is the biggest slices but me and my friends where pleased with the food
Great deep dish at a great price.
Awesome atmosphere and super affable service. The food was crisp and enchanting. Will easily recommend this spot to friends and family. Affordable prices and big portions. Great job.
Love this pizza joint!!!

Have to say that the pan pizza here by the slice is the best i've ever had.There is a quick turnover on pizza cooked and put under the hear lamps and pizza eaten.And the thin crust is just as good. Try Art's special; sausage,onions,green peppers,and mushrooms.
Good for a quick slice!

Absolutely amazing! We came from out of town and wanted true "Chicago-style" pizza. This place had that and more! The staff were friendly, the dining area was clean and had plenty of tables, and the location was perfect, just a few minutes from our hotel on Michigan Ave. We will definitely visit again the next time we're in town!
Best deep dish I have ever had!
Service was exceptional, pizza was ok
The stuffed slices are my favorite item to get here. I wish they had sides like fries at this location. Staff are friendly and service is fast.

The pizza is not that great, but the value and quick service make up for it. I had a slice of of the meaty stuffed pizza and there were a lot of toppings and cheese, but the pizza itself had a really soggy/mushy crust and was just lukewarm. The mozzarella sticks were pretty good for what it's worth. $4.99 for 6 mozz sticks.
(Translated by Google) Delicious!!!  (Original) Delicioso!!!
Decent pizza, great salads!
Good pizza.
Good simple pizza
Great food and customer service!!
Don't order a thin crust pepperoni AND a stuffed spinach and mushroom just for yourself. Way too much and so tasty you can't make yourself leave any crumbs.

I gotta give this place 5 stars even though I only had one slice of pizza here. It was almost 9 at night and they had a variety of thin, pan, and stuffed pizza. I got a slice of the Art's Special stuffed for 5 bucks and it was great. I was worried it would be old from sitting under the lights for too long but it was very fresh and very good. The place was full, mostly of college students, but I managed to find a place to sit down and eat. Any place that has very good pan and stuffed pizza by the slice that is fresh and a reasonable price deserves 5 stars in my book. There was the creep that stole my napkins off my table when I went to get oregano and hot peppers for my slice, but I won't penalize the pizza place for him.  Update: My brother and I went here a few weeks ago during lunch during the week. We both got stuffed slices like I got before, but this time it wasn't nearly as good. The bottom crust didn't seem quite done, and the top layer was very doughy. I don't know why it wasn't nearly as good as the first time, but I have to reduce my rating a star to 4 based on my 2 experiences and my brother's opinion of his slice. I will try again next time in Chicago, though!
This place doesn’t serve deep dish but stuffed crust instead of deep dish (as well as “other”).  It’s good pizza but i wouldn’t go out of my way either.
(Translated by Google) Good, but up there. Advantage of selling by slice  (Original) Bien, pero hasta ahí. Ventaja de que venden por slice
I loved the slices and the service was excellent.
They're subs are humongous and DELICIOUS!!!
Good pizza
Great pizza at a great price.
Awful pizza. They smother the pizza in tomato paste which has no flavor. Crust is horrible. Do not eat here!
Pizza was ehh...had the pepperoni and the Italian sausage slices. Nothing to write home about. The service was excellent tho.

Chicago pizza is just not for me. In my opinion, there's no reason for the sauce to be outside of the cheese. It's like a thick, dry cake with too much cheese and not enough pepperoni. Couldn't finish the one slice--couldn't imagine ordering a whole pie. Strange. This place puts the topping (pepperoni for example) in the top left corner so you know what it is.  I went back a second time and got a 'thin' slice which was the thickness of a normal slice of pizza.
Good cheap slice
There was a long wait for Lou's down the street so I decided to check google for other places and this place was very good! Pizza sauce was sooooo good.
Great place ..small but great
Love their pizza!
Didn't want to wait 3 hours for Lou's down the street. Walked in here and got served immediately. They also let us BYOB. Pizza was great.
Pizza was just OK (thin crust). A bit overpriced for the quality.
Nice, tiny little place, awesome food!! Even got a piece of cake,too!
If anyone gives this place less than 4 stars they Don't know good pizza.
Great food and atmosphere
The pizza was just OK taste was good if you near that location I would go. I would not go out of my way. Price was very good for two slices.
Pizza was delicious, the service was friendly and quick, and the establishment was clean. Loved the mural on the wall!
Yummy Pizza and the staff is friendly.
Good Pizza and water and sodas
Pizza by the slice great , feel like a couple slices now and few later 10inch Stufffed is the way to go😋
Real deep pan pizza
Great pizza
The lone-deep-dish-pizza-slice seeker's friend. Deep dish by the slice. You don't have to wait 45 minutes for a pie that you shouldn't realistically eat by yourself! 😄
Sold pizza by the slice and it was super good
It was good to eat alone as you can have a slice.
Pan pizza is amazing.
Pizza is whack! But it's a semi-cheap eat and gets you in and out faster than restaurants nearby.
Don't expect seating. Pizza is okay.
Great pizza! Had stuffed crust cheese slice.
AWESOME!! The have some great options for pizza slices (Hot & Ready)! ALSO, their desserts are super yummy! Price for their pizzas is really on point! DELICIOUS

It was ok I guess? Personally, I think Lou's is a lot better. Tried Lou's with a native Chicago friend, and then I went to try this place on my own.  Might give it a try again in the future, but for now I'd still say that Lou's is the best I've had so far in Chicago.
my favorite thin crust in Chi Town!!! This New Yorker approves :) super affordable, huge NY slices, perfect location.
Awesome deep dish. Pie or cut.
worst pizza I ever had.
Love Art's Special slice thin crust!!!
Fantastic deep dish pizza
Huge slices of pizza for the right place! Great location and friendly customer service. I highly recommend this for pizza lovers 🍕🍕
Love variety! And when I get an opportunity to have choices of a slice of pizza that's not just meat is A OK with me and then the taste was awesome I shall return!

I am in town for a convention, and promised myself that I would try legit Chicago deep dish while I was here, and I'm glad that I stopped here. I found it by accident just walking around, and it was great. A+ food, A+ service.
Great pizza, good selection of slices ready to go, fast and good price.
Very good sized slices for the price
Favorite pizza in the south loop area. The pan crust is my favorite.

I’ve stopped in many times late at night to grab a slice, which I’ve always enjoyed, but on the Friday before St. Patrick’s day weekend, the doors were locked by 11:45. Really disappointed as they’re supposed to be open until midnight.
Love it!

This was the first pizza place we tried during a long weekend in Chicago. We spent the best part of the weekend trying different recommended pizza places. This was by far our favorite pizza place. We tried the regular crust, cheese stuffed crust and sausage stuffed crust, all were delicious. Definitely worth a trip! Oh, and the carrot cake looked amazing!

Really small little pizza joint with some excellent pizza!  This small, unassuming spot does deep dish right and has been some of my favorite on this trip to Chicago.   Stuffed crust pizza is totally worth it.  My daughter really enjoyed the sausage stuffed crust.  Pan pizza was pretty decent, but not nearly as great as the cheese stuffed crust.

I actually really like this place. When I want a quick slice of pizza, this is my go-to. The staff were nice the times I’ve visited and I’ve never had any issues with my order. Based on the quality and price, I think it’s a fair deal. You can buy full pizzas but I haven’t yet because one slice for $4 fills me up.

A weak imitation of the Art of Pizza on Ashland.  Their employees make it clear they do not care about their customers and act as if they are being forced to work their.  While the portion sizes are good for the price, the  pizza just does not hold up well when they are willing to serve it cold.
Deep dish slices that have hung out under a heat lamp for a long time are never great. I felt like I got less than I paid for.
Good Chicago pizza mostly by the slice, very casual

Satisfied my pizza with a crispy crust late night craving, but after several bites, I didn't want to finish the second half of the slice that they gave me. The cheese has a nice softness to it, though.
It was tasty but clear that it had been sitting around for a awhile as it was barely warm.
The arts special thin crust is pretty good. They cut the peppers and onions in slices though which was not my favorite but the flavor is there! Casual spot, very affordable.
Good pizza

The slices of pizza are sometimes not good if they have been sitting for a while. However, the subs are good. In fact the subs maybe one of the better deals in town. If you want the Pizza, you are better off ordering a full pie. So, go with Friends. Deep dish is good, but the thin crust is the best.
Possibly the best deep dish in the city, definitely my favorite. One of the few that offers slices.
I love their pepperoni and sausage pizza...
The rumors are true. I just had a slice of their delicious spinach onion deep dish pizza

I hate giving them a 2 star since i have tasted their stuffed pizza many times and at its best would get a 5 star however, when i went today they surved me two dry and old slices that were not good at all. What disappoints me is that i im on a diet and finally reached a cheat day and it was wasted on this. Also, it clearly looked old and dry so i felt like they didnt care, that they just wanted to get rid of it. Anyway, if i ever go back i will change this rating depending on the quality of pizza they serve.
Truly "just ok". I had expected more based on the reviews. Next time I will follow my instincts and stick with Pequod's
It is unusual to have three different styles of pizza available by the slice and have them all be good, but this place pulls it off.
I recommend!v Fantastic slices, great prices and no wait. So glad I stopped in.
Amazing deep dish pizza! Stuffed crust with veggies and a moist base. Plus they have slices that is best for single person and smaller meals.
Fantastic slices, great prices and no wait. So glad I stopped in.
Totally awesome pizza! The stuffed crust was out of this world!
Amazing deep dish by the slice

Amazing meat lovers pizza, already made so you don't have to wait if all you want is a slice. At first the price for one deep dish slice caught me off guard, but it was worth it because it was more filling than I expected. Took a friend from out of town there and she loved it as well!

Small neighborhood takeaway and with a few tables, pizza, salads, subs. The deep dish or "stuffed" is excellent, particularly the spinach and the special. The salads are also surprisingly good. Definitely would recommend.
Definition of Chicago deep dish! Everything you would expect from it.

Best pizza in the whole city! I have been going to The Art of Pizza up on Ashland for about 5 years or so. From the first bite I took of the deep dish sausage, I immediately knew this was a special deep dish pizza. Since then, I have tried Giordano’s, Uno's, Lou Malnati's, Gino's East, and countless other places. None of those places hold a candle to The Art of Pizza. Believe me when I say that The Art of Pizza houses the best deep dish pizza in the city and since Chi-Town is the deep dish mecca, the best deep dish pizza in the world. Do yourself a favor and stop by. On top of that, you don't have to wait 45 minutes to eat like at the other spots.  One recommendation to the manager though as far as the State St. location is concerned. You may want to consider getting a few more staff. Your staff are great! I just noticed when I went in to this location, the line got a bit long and I saw someone walk out because of it.
Wife and I were in town for a concert and randomly came across this place while walking around our hotel. It was amazing thick crust. Highly recommend, a place we will seek out again.

A pure Chicago treasure.This is a venerable pizza uniquely seasoned with fresh ingredients and a beautiful crust.Served warm not hot.A few tables for Dine in preference.Limited menu.Service Good.Pricing reasonable and inexpensive.No parking. Nothing fancy here.Simple and delicious. Definitely better than any carpetbagger pizza chain. AWARDED 2 YUMS ON A SCALE OF 3
Was a nice Chicago style pizza. Not quite as good as the Lou Malnati's Pizzeria in River North I went to.
Best pizza in Chicago.  Both locations are outstanding!
(Translated by Google) The pieces are packed and delicious-very close to His Chicago Hostel  (Original) 조각 포장되고 맛있어요- 하이시카고 호스텔에서 가까워요
Really good Chicago deep dish!
Pizza was alright. Reheated.
Very authentic.. the deep dish is the best in Chicago right now
(Translated by Google) It’s a good place to fill your stomach. The thick cakes taste good.  (Original) 填飽肚子還不錯的地方 ,厚的餅皮吃起來味道不錯

I had hyped up Chicago style pizza to my daughter for weeks before we flew there from Frankfurt. Thank God y'all knocked the ball out of the park ... she loved it. So did the redhead and I ... it was amazing!!!
Why wait for a table, then argue over toppings? Get the same quality by the slice instead!
Great pizza. Just wish there was better parking.
Terrible pizza
Great pizza for $5 a slice

I’ve tried ordering pizza here twice shortly after 11pm on a Saturday and they stated they were closed.  I also visited at 1115pm and the doors were already locked.  All this despite their website stating they are open until midnight on Friday and Saturday.  Very disappointing.
Crispy, chewy, cheesy. Amazing.
Art of Pizza has the best thin crust pizza in town. The crust is just right, the sauce isn't too tangy, and they're pretty generous with the cheese. Eat this pizza!!
Best stufed pizza, better than Lou Malnati's subs are no joke either. pic is of an italian sub, TRUE footlong puts jimmy johns and especially subway to shame
Great price for some very tasty pizza. It's pizza by the slice so no waiting.
Pizza was amazing. I always go deep in chicago you should too.
Great pizza. Tough for parking though. Otherwise would be 5 Star. Just as good as other location. Have whole pizzas and pizzas by the slice. Paint yourself some pizza at Art of Pizza!
First time at Art of Pizza was fun! My friend did not like his thin crust, but I liked my deep dish. You win some, you lose some I guess. Jesse was great and went beyond his CoD (black ops). Yeehaw
Huge tasty slices

Pizza is as delicious as the other location but this location does not have parking so keep that in mind if you come here. This location also does not have the full menu so if you are used to ordering food other than pizza you may want to double check to make sure it served here. Finally, this location uses paper plates and plastic utensils which are horrible to use. The other location provides glass plates and metal silverware which makes for a much better experience. The pizza here is still great but the things I noted definitely hurt the experience.
The other location is better,  but this is still Ggood value

They have stuffed slices, first time there and the pizza is good. It's hard to find a place that sells slices, let alone good slices in the downtown area. I'll definitely be back. Loved the buttery crust! I almost want to o cone back in for another slice

South Loop is lucky to have this restaurant's second location in the neighborhood! Great pizza, and by the slice no less!! Definitely be sure to get the deep dish. I'll be choosing this place over Lou's next time...
I’m from Grand Rapids, MI, here for a lions-bears game and this was the best pizza I’ve ever had. Amazing.
Deep dish is just bunch of bread with a very thing layer of cheese and ingredients.  Not worth the $5.
This is my favorite pizza place in Chicago but I do prefer the original place to this one.
Went in for two slices of stuffed pizza. Slices were luke warm but tasted okay. Friendly staff. My friends really liked their thin crust slices. Will have to try that next time.
One of my first deepdish pizzas, amazing
I had both a thin crust and a deep-dish pizza and they were both amazing! Also, thanks for staying open past 10!
Best pizza in the area!!
so glad you guys came downtown love art of pizza
Top 5 pizza places for sure.
One of the best pizza places in town top 5 (my favorite) any slice
Hands down best pizza in Chicago!! Get the meaty delight!
